page.title: 16INDUSTRY - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: Apart from farming there are few industries in this area, but as a reaction against the standardisation of the age there is considerable nostalgia for the past, and old timber-framed buildings have become a commercial proposition. These are bought elsewhere, and brought to this district for repair, using green oak from the woodland of N.E. Petworth. The infill is knocked out, the frame repaired, reconstructed, and each part numbered. Sections are re-erected on the new site. A cider mill, sixty feet by twenty feet, was despatched by this firm, 'English Heritage Oak', to Kansas City, America, for #40,000. Next was a cottage, re-erected in Horsham. In September 1985 the enterprise is moving to a quarry on Bognor Common, two miles south.
